page.title: 18 Staunton cont'd.
page.content: Most of the land around Staunton is farmland but the village will remain small, as no more building is allowed. Tom Drury, whose family has lived in the village for three generations, is a joiner and wheelwright. Events such as fetes and jousting tournaments are held in the village. {Folly Hill}otherwise known as{Molly's {Folly}lies between Staunton and Long Bennington. It belongs to{Mr.Edward {Staunton.}The cottage on the hill has a panchion roof but no electricity or mains drainage.{Mr.George Henderson, who lives alone in the cottage alerts villagers when necessary by raising a flag up a pole. Close to Folly Hill is the Dowell Schlumberger UK training centre which is for oilrig trainees from all over the world. It provides work for local people looking after the trainees.
